summary: Interactive romantic-themed Valentine proposal web page (HTML/CSS/JS) with Yes/No choices, evasive No button, and on Yes reveal a "Good Choice" meme image.
architectural_notes: Use a single self-contained HTML file with embedded CSS/JS for easy local execution in Chrome on mobile/laptop.
imageRequirements:
## Required Images
- Meme-style image with bold, high-contrast caption text that reads "Good Choice" on a romantic/pink-friendly palette (valentine-good-choice-meme.dim_1200x800.png)

existing_features.title: Create a single-screen romantic Valentine proposal page that asks: "Will you be my Valentine?" and presents exactly two choices: "Yes" and "No".
Implement the evasive behavior for the "No" option: when the user moves their cursor/pointer over (or toward) the "No" control, it should move away so it cannot be clicked.
When the user clicks "Yes", transition the page to show a meme image with the text "Good Choice".
Apply a consistent romantic visual theme using a pink and white color scheme, including typography, spacing, and background styling, and ensure the layout is responsive for mobile and desktop Chrome.
Store any generated images as static assets and render them directly from the frontend (do not route images through the backend).

Update the "Yes"-clicked (answered) state so that instead of showing the "Good Choice" meme reveal, it displays two separate images: (1) an image containing the Bible verse text: "So they are no longer two, but one flesh. Therefore, what God has joined together, let no one separate." and (2) an image that says "Marry me".
Add the new Bible verse image and the new "Marry me" image as static assets under the frontend public generated-assets path and render them directly from the frontend (no backend involvement).
Update the post-"Yes" (answered) view so that it shows a single meme image with the text "Good Choice" (instead of showing the Bible verse image and the "Marry me" image).
Add the "Good Choice" meme image as a static frontend asset under the generated assets path and render it directly from the frontend (no backend involvement).

new_feature_requests.summary: Create a simple romantic-themed interactive Valentine web page (pink/white) asking 'Will you be my valentine?' runnable locally in Chrome on phone/laptop
Add Yes/No options where the No button moves away on hover to prevent clicking
On clicking Yes, transition the page to show a meme image telling her "Good Choice"
